name: Hotel Riu Palace Paradise Island

reviews.text: Please everyone reading these reviews, ignore the negative ones. My Mom and I went last year and had the time of our lives! Here is our review of:
reviews.title: Most amazing trip ever!!!
Loved the Riu!!
reviews.text: Travel: If you don't want to spend two hours on a bus, this is the place for you. The bus ride from the Nassau airport to the hotel is probably just above 30 minutes and you get a nice little tour of the island.

Check In: Although we had to wait an hour to check in, we didn't mind at all..it gave us time to go for an entire tour of the hotel, as well as ask questions about how to book dinner reservations. The hour went by like a flash!
reviews.title: Business visit at the Paradise island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: No, they aren't updated. But if you rate a hotel in the South based on its room...your priorities are very mixed up. I believe I spent literally 7 hours a day there..sleeping. The rooms have great views of the ocean, safes, always hot water, were clean and had lots of extra pillows and blankets.
reviews.title: Riu Paradise Island

likes.liked: — the beach and the casino so close by
likes.disliked: — the food and drinks for all inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: Always something different to try in the buffet. Although it was all the same food, I switched it up each day. One day I would eat more 'americanized' food like hamburgers and fries. The next day I would have jerk chicken and seafood. My Mom and I tried every a la carte restaurant and loved them all, however we took to the Sir Alexander; champagne on arrival, four course, great service. Just wonderful.
reviews.title: Loved my trip! Would go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 4-night stay at the Riu. We went on a business trip and stayed at the Cove for the first 4 nights, so the Riu was a huge downgrade! In short, this hotel needs a major facelift. The food is good and most of the people working at the hotel are nice. They all accept tips and we try to be generous. The location is great because it's next door to Atlantis and you can walk over to the Casino, Marina Village, etc. If you want, you can buy a day pass for Atlantis and make use of the water park and their facilities. The beach is also beautiful and big and you are a short ride from town. It is a better location than Cable Beach. The buffet food was good, especially breakfast and lunch- they always had a variety and we are not picky eaters. The drinks are so-so/we're not big drinkers. BUT - the biggest problem are the rooms which really need to be renovated - old carpeting, old toilets, old bathtubs and faucets, pretty disgusting. Our second room (the first one was facing the noisy compressors), had a rusty tub which was covered with an old rubber mat - nasty, eh? The corridors stink because the carpeting is old and some doors do not even close properly. The elevators are a disaster and need to be renovated. It is not a five star and I can't wait for them to renovate it in 2009! The entertainment is not that great, either, but we spent most of our evenings at Atlantis, either in the Marina Village where they have live bands all the time and Junkanoo on Friday and Saturday, or in the bars inside the Casino. If you don't mind the rooms, I am sure you will be fine. We love the Bahamians, and we find them very knowledgeable and friendly. My suggestion is, if you want to go to the Bahamas, stay at either the Atlantis or go the Comfort suites across the road and you get full access to the Atlantis facilities. Otherwise, you can stay on Cable beach, but there is not much to do.
reviews.title: It's not a five star...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back last week from RIU and after reading some of the other reviews on here I wanted to write my own. All in all, your getting a really good deal for your money. The all inclusive deal really works and it worked great for us. Check in was a walk in the park. No problems. The wait in line for the reservations for the speciality restaurants were not that bad. Tip: Get in line about 5:50pm, the line is almost empty by then and the wait will be just a few minutes. The rooms were average. Some of the rooms do have great views. The room comes with a mini refrig stocked with soda beer and avove the refrig is some hard liquor (If your a drinker, this is the place for you). The buffet is good. I enjoyed the desert part the best. Lots of good sweet treats. The breakfast buffet is good as well (the pancakes are on the crunchy side). The bar by the poolside and in the lobby is easy to access and you can have all the drinks you want. Getting on the beach and finding the beach chair is very simple. The staff is friendly and easy to deal with. To sum things up, if your looking for a good deal at a great price this is the place for you. Come with a good appetite and be prepared to put on a few pounds. If your looking for something more elegant and fancy and have the money to throw away, then the Atlantis across the street would be your place. Also, many things to do and keep busy while your there. We did the Robinson Crusoe tour which takes you to a remote island (rose island), it was fun but it got a bit boring. We also did the casino, which was fun, but its mostly primed for heavy betters (min tables are $15 and most of the tables are at least $25 ones. If your a high roller you will fit in much better at the casino. Have a fun time at the RIU..
reviews.title: A great value for your money

likes.disliked: — Rooms were very plain and needed upgrading

reviews.text: We just came home today from a one week stay in this hotel. We were travelling with a group of 20 couples and it seems everyone felt the same. We changed rooms because the first room overlooked the loud airconditioning units. Then our second room has a partial view of the pool area. Speaking of the pool, it is not heated and the level was low - below the strainer baskets. The pumps were not working and it was apparent nobody was cleaning the pool. The bar drinks were not premium, but rather local concoctions that tasted cheap! The specialty restaurants were horrible,.. when you could book for the next evening. The daily lunch room is a bad cafeteria...complete with cardboard burgers and lots of greasy food. Our room was without towels twice, and although the 3rd floor is labelled as a non-smoking floor - our airconditioner pumped in smokey air everytime it cycled. The stuffing was falling out of the beds - which are ripped open from old age. The carpets are ripped, the pink wallpaper is from days gone by... and the furniture should be given away. The tub was rusted about 1 inch from the floor along the whole length and the complimentary shampoo and products were cheap paper vouchers. When we looked at some websites that rated this hotel a 4 star facility,.. I wonder where these ratings originated from. Our whole group was very disappointed indeed. The staff have the island attitude that the guests are to be ignored! Don't waste your money or precious time here folks. This hotel is a dump....2 stars...nothing further.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel stay ever!

likes.liked: — The beach, sun, and clean ocean.
likes.disliked: — The hotel is run down and requires major renovations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing trip! I've been to the Riu Paradise Island four times and can't wait to go again. There are just some people that like to complain about everything. Wrong type of beer, no fillet mignon and jumbo shrimp. I'm sorry but for the price I paid, I got more than my money's worth. The staff is always looking to help you, the food is incredible and the drinks are delicious.
reviews.title: Loved the Riu, Paradise Island

likes.disliked: — Ride from the airport too long and sometimes went through local streets which was scary/

reviews.title: Great Location, Had a wonderful time!
reviews.text: The variety is unbelievable. For those that want the finner things in life, go and pay for them. I loved the place. The best part....it's right next door to the Atlantis which makes for lots to do at night. Dont forget to visit the straw market.....and bargain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, I just got back from the RIU and I was very pleasantly suprised! I was extremely worried after reading all of the reviews on this website and almost cancelled and booked somewhere else. I am very glad that I didn't.
reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised!

likes.disliked: — I would have liked more options for nighttime entertainment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel very cute. The rooms are not super new but the lobby is nice, the bars are nice, and the dining rooms are nice. Our room had a great view of the ocean, a balcony and a sliding glass door that we left open all night to hear the ocean breeze.
reviews.title: Surprising above average

reviews.text: As far as food, we enjoyed just about everything. We were only there for three nights so we tried two of the restaurants and the buffet. I'm sure that if I had been there longer I would have wanted more variety but for three days, it was perfect.
reviews.title: Change your option

reviews.text: There is not much to do at the RIU but Atlantis is right next door. I enjoyed being able to walk over there at night but I also enjoyed being at our own hotel where is was more quiet and friendly. The location is perfect as it is really right next door. No one ever questionned us about walking around everywhere (day or night) without an Atlantis wrist band.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately recommend this place and am already planning a return trip sometime later in the spring!
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a three night stay during Superbowl weekend at the Riu. We arrived early and we had no problems getting to our room right away. We had problems with our door key but you just have to put it in slowly and were fine after that. The rooms are outdated but clean...you do need to bring your own toiletries(no hair conditioner in the bathrooms). We lucked out on the weather since it had been cool the previous days we got there. The food were plentiful! The steakhouse and the gourmet restaurants were fabulous! You do have to make a reservations the day before which were not a big deal. The sun at thepool area is only from 11am til 4pm...at the beach is longer so if you are a sun worshipper...hang out at the beach. I was scared after reading all the reviews but I am glad that we went. Atlantis was just a walk away for some night action but we found that after sun and fun at the beach, nightlfe was not a big deal. We were there to relax and unwind; and we did! Go ahead book your trip to Riu!
reviews.title: Not Bad At All...

likes.liked: — The food was plenty to choose from
likes.disliked: — The rooms could really use a major lift but they said renovations are coming

reviews.text: Within the first hour at our arrival at the Riu, we had 2 cell phones stolen from our room, and the management and the Riu administrative offices did nothing about it and offered no compensation for the theft. The safes in both rooms we had were not working. There were other guests as well to whom we spoke who also experienced theft. Also disappointing were the rooms and the amenities. This was supposed to be a 4 star hotel, but I would not give it more than 3 stars. The rooms are not updated, are musty, and the sheets, blankets and towels are tattered and very thin. The bathrooms were small and also not updated. We would definitely not stay here again, nor would be recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Ripped off at the Riu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week at the RIU. We were somewhat disappointed in the appearance of the hotel. It definitely needs a overall facelift, which I understand they plan on doing in 2009. The rooms were OK - definitely need to be updated. Housekeeping kept them clean. Our mini bar in the room which was supposed to be restocked every other day was stocked only once all week. This was our "first" all inclusive experience so, we weren't sure what to expect. Surprisingly, the drinks were not weak. The buffet food was average but, we soon tired of the same selections every day. Guess we're not used to the all -inclusive concept and having to eat only at your hotel. Think we prefer venturing out of the resort to sample local restuarants for dinner. They did have 3 specialty restuarants in which you had to make dinner reservations the day before and only between 5-6 pm. We found that to be a hassle having to make plans the day before and then having to remember to go get on a line in the lobby between 5-6pm. You had 2 dinner seating times to chose from 6:30 or 8:30pm. (Much like a cruise ship) Not sure if that's how all of the "all inclusives" resorts tend to be. We enjoyed the atmosphere in the restuarants. Despite the fact you only had a very limited menu ( 3 main course selections) it was a nice change of pace from the buffets. The Bahamas Steak house and the Japanese restuarant were our favorites. They had nightly entertainment in the lounge that was enjoyable. We love to be on the beach or by the pool (self proclaimed "sun worshipers") Unfortunately, the way the building is situated, the pool area doesn't see any sun until late morning and starts to shade by 4 pm. As a result of a lack of sun, the water was cold. On the beach you must calculate where to lay so the building doesn't block your sunlight. We did not realize the vendors had full access to the beach so, you were constantly bombarded by people wanting to braid your hair, sell you stuff and rent you jet skiis immediately after reaching the bottom steps of the resort onto the beach. We understand, after vacationing in places like Mexico, that's how alot of countries are but, we find it to be horribly annoying. We vacation twice a year in Aruba and this does not occur there. We took a taxi to the shopping area (where the cruise ships dock) and found it to be somewhat shabby. We were stopped and begged for $$ quite often. (Again, not what we are familiar with when visiting Aruba) Overall, our trip to the Bahamas & The RIU wasn't "horrible." We have very high expectations as a result of vacationing on islands like Aruba and staying at hotels such as the Marriott.
reviews.title: RIU - Needs some TLC

reviews.text: We had booked a deluxe ocean view room at an added cost so my wife could watch the sunrise and sunset. Apon arrival we where given room 916 which overlooks noisy roof top equiptment. When we complained about the view we where moved to the 15th Floor room 1526 which still overlooked the roof and has a 41" solid wall instead of the metal rails shown in all the photos. Out of the three elevators only one goes to this floor so you had to wait about ten minutes to be able to get an elevator, after reaching in and sending the othger two to the 14th floor and hoping your only source of transportation arrived first. We did put in another request to be moved but did not get an resond for the remainder of the week. Other problems included room card did not work and we had to make two trips to get it programed. The water was shut off for about two hours when a pipe burst on the second floor just when my wife wanted to take a shower. The emergency doors from this floor lend not a staircase but to the hotel roof from there I don't know you are to go to get out of this hotel. This is the our second trip to this hotel, last year we though we got the same view because we booked late so we booked in Sept thinking we would get a good room, as far as can tell it first come first served when you arrive, by the way all of the even numbered rooms have the noise and the roof top view.
reviews.title: Vacation from Hell

reviews.text: We just got back from a four night stay at the Riu! We had a blast. We were a little put off by all the negative reviews, but one of our party had been there before and so we were not worried. Our rooms were comfortable overlooking the pool...make sure you request an upper floor overlooking the pool. If you get a room overlooking the airconditioning, as long as you are on an upper floor (above 9) you will be okay! Toilets in room seem to have a flushing problem, that doesn't seem to happen anywhere else in the hotel. The rooms are stocked with liquor dispensers, which we never made use of. The fridges in the room each have a jug of water for drinking...they say not to drink the tap water. The buffet breakfast has everthing you could think of. We got there late on our first day and had the buffet dinner and were pleasantly surprised. The Steakhouse is quite good. You have to stand in line at 5P(get there early) for a reservation for restaurants. Definitely eat at Sir Alexanders, it is their gourmet restaurent . We spent our evenings next door at the Atlantis gambling...slots only. The tables were $100 minimum...too high for us. We did go out to eat one night at Bobby Flays restaurant Mesa Grill at the Atlantis, but were a little disappointed...service and food were not what we expected for $100 per person. It was fun being around the beautiful people...saw Derek Jeter, Cuba Gooding Jr, Maury Povich and Connie Chung (it was the weekend of the Michael Jordan Golf Invitational). The beach at the Riu is great. If you want to get a good spot down by the water, go early with your beach towel and have the pool staff set your chair up and just leave you towel on your chair. Otherwise it does tend to get crowed early. If you want an umbrella, that is run by a separate company. They tried to get us to pay $50/day for an umbrella, but we got him down to $40/day for 2 umbrellas as there were 7 of us. By 3P we were ready for a little shade. The only thing I didn't like about the Rui is the overwhelming smell from smokers. Even though we were on a nonsmoking floor, I could still smell stale smoke even in my room. There were smokers everywhere!
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

aka: Riu Palace Paradise Island Hotel Paradise Island
description: * Located on Paradise Island (the Bahamas), 3 km/1.8 miles from Nassau * 100 m/328 ft from "Atlantis", the largest casino in the Caribbean * 14-story building * On the beachfront * Complimentary sun loungers on the beach * 3 km/1.8 miles to downtown Nassau * 200 m/656 ft from various shops * 25 km/15.5 miles from the airport * 200 m/656 ft from a bus stop * Credit cards accepted: MasterCard, Amex, Visa, Diners
